Name: Strawberry Daiquiri
Ingredients: 60 ml Light gold rum (1-3 year old molasses column)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0Â°Brix)
3 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of strawberry (or half if large) with mint sprig tip leaves.
MUDDLE strawberries (4 to 7 depending on size) in the base of the shaker.
Add other ingredients and SHAKE with ice.
Garnish with strawberry (or half if large) on rim with mint sprig tip leaves.
Review: Makes strawberries and cream appear very dull. NOTE: Strawberry pulp is notorious for blocking strainers and sink wastes. Hence, double straining is essential when making this cocktail, as is the use of a quality Hawthorne strainer (I use one with an extra spring and a wide-gauge fine strainer with a large capacity). The Hawthorne strainer should retain most of the fruit pulp, along with the ice in the shaker. Pouring through an additional fine strainer ensures the clarity of the cocktail. Even with the best strainers, the pulp will start to restrict the flow towards the end of the pour and moving your shaker to help the liquid find a new escape route helps. Finally, use a bar spoon to help move the pulp in the fine strainer to allow the last of the cocktail through the strainer. Also, don't be tempted to make two cocktails in one shaker by doubling quantities, as this will compound pulp issues. The cocktail is worth the faff!
History: A popular cocktail in Cuba where it is known as a Daiquiri de Fresa. See: Daiquiri cocktail history
